chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent F Sormankiewicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challeng Incarceration Progam and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 7 days were granted if imposed.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Defendant is not to use or possess any weapons.

No Violent Contact with the victim. Agent may suspend contact if deemed appropriate or necessary. Comply with any mental health / psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Vincent F Sormankiewicz in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Bayer makes statements regarding victim notification. Court takes recess for the State to speak to the victim in the case. Case recalled at 10:27 am. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of Count #1. Counts #2-6 are dismissed and read in. Victim makes statements. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Kershek gives sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statements. Court sentences the defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6_YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT 7 days, if revoked)          ****CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE****
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  5 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug fparaphernalia. 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases. 
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No VIOLENT contact with: victim. Agent may suspend contact if deemed appropriate/necessary. 
____Not to use or possess any weapons.
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done. 

COSTS:  $368.00 + $250 DNA surcharge.  (to be paid out of cash bail posted, remainder to be returned to poster)

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
